fields.summary: Precisely-pinned boto version causing new installs to fail to start

fields.description:
-Boto version 2.34.0 is missing the implementation to retrieve ConnectionSettingAttribute and ConnectionDrainingAttribute when DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes API is called.-

-Boto 2.38.0 contains the implementation, however it's current in epel-testing repo. Need to upgrade to Boto 2.38.0 when it becomes available in epel repo.-

UPDATE: Boto 2.34 does include the ConnectionSettingAttribute and ConnectionDrainingAttribute.  Although the update to 2.38 isn't critical, it would be nice to pin the console to a more recent version of Boto.

comments.body: 2.38.0 is available in epel testing, please give that a try.

Verified that boto 2.38.0 has the implementation for retrieving the ConnectionSettingAttribute of a load balancer. 

LbAttributes(CrossZoneLoadBalancingAttribute(False), AccessLog(False, None, None, None), ConnectionDraining(False, 300), ConnectionSettingAttribute(60))
Verified that boto 2.38.0 solves this issue, however, boto 2.38.0 is still in epel-testing repo for CentOS at the moment.
[~kyolee]: Why was this assigned to me for review?  And I don't see it in the current sprint.  /cc [~jloza]

[~kgill] to inform you that, when tested the boto 2.38.0, it was confirmed that 2.38.0 does have the full ELB attributes class implemented. But, since it's still in epel-testing repo, I don't think there is an immediate action item for this ticket.

[~kyolee]: Understood, thanks for the info.  Perhaps we should change the title of the ticket to "Require Boto 2.38.0 or greater since 2.34.0 does not support..." to make it easier for QA to confirm the fix?
The title and description of the ticket has been updated.
Thank you [~kyolee].  I've reassigned this to [~gholms] to ensure the console packages pin Boto to 2.38 after it's available in EPEL.
[~gholms], is there work that needs to be done, or are we waiting for the EPEL process?
The update needs +3 before it will go stable.  Please test it and provide feedback after logging in here:  https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-5760/

[~kyolee], [~gholms], [~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: I'm not sure this ticket's title/description is accurate.  Looking at the Boto source at https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/2.34.0/boto/ec2/elb/attributes.py#L22 and https://github.com/boto/boto/blob/2.34.0/boto/ec2/elb/attributes.py#L97 Boto 2.34 *does* have the attribute classes we need for ELB work in 4.2.  I removed the custom attribute classes in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/87e71e30902fc422dcc91ec4a6761961419c2247 and it works just fine.  We could continue to pursue the update to Boto 2.38, but it's no longer a blocker for ELB work AFAICT.
Definitely good news that it's no longer a blocker for ELB. Worth pursuing 2.38.0 just to stay up to date?
I'm using 2.38 on my laptop and so far, so good. (up-voted as well)
